testcase.name: UsedOn
testcase.description: Section 5.1.3.4 and Section 5.1.4.5 - The element where the role/arcrole is used MUST correspont to an instance of the QName defined in the roleType/arcroleType declaration but ONLY if it is used inside a standard extended link or in a custom extended link with a roleRef/arcroleRef pointing to the roleType/arcroleType declaration

variation.name: 160-01-roleType-standard-linkbase-incorrect-element-Invalid
variation.description: A new roleType definition contains a usedOn element pointing to a valid QName but a standard linkbase uses it in a different element (a label resource)- Invalid

variation.name: 160-02-roleType-standard-linkbase-incorrect-element-Invalid
variation.description: A new roleType definition contains a usedOn element pointing to a valid QName but a standard linkbase uses it in a different element (a labelLink element)- Invalid

variation.name: 160-04-roleType-non-standard-linkbase-incorrect-element-Valid
variation.description: A new roleType definition contains a usedOn element pointing to a valid QName a custom linkbase uses it in a different element but there is no a roleRef pointing to the roleType declaration - Valid

variation.name: 160-05-roleType-non-standard-linkbase-incorrect-element-invalid
variation.description: This is the same 160-04 test case but the hidden schema imports a new taxonomy in the DTS. That imported schema is not a valid taxonomy and it should be ignored because it is not in the DTS. - valid
